Generation I.Red: Formed by several Magnemite s linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Formed by several Magnemite s linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
Generation I.Yellow: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6F degrees within 3,300 feet .
Generation I.Stadium: Formed by Magnemite that link together when the number of black spots on the sun increases. Fires high-voltage power, etc.

Generation II.Gold: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
Generation II.Silver: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinities.
Generation II.Crystal: When many Magneton gather together, the resulting magnetic storm disrupts radio waves.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in their vicinity. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pok é mon .
Generation III.Sapphire: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pok é mon inside a Pok é Ball .
Generation III.Emerald: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. It generates powerful radio waves that raise temperatures by 3.6 degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.
Generation III.FireRed: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite . It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
Generation IV.Pearl: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
Generation IV.Platinum: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.

Generation V.Black: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
Generation V.White: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
Generation V.Black 2: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.
Generation V.White 2: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

Generation VI.X: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
Generation VI.Y: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet .
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.

Generation VII.Sun: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
Generation VII.Moon: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather in high places to wait for lightning to strike.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet .
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet .

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: A Magneton is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group of these Pokémon can set off a magnetic storm.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: A Magneton is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group of these Pokémon can set off a magnetic storm.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
Generation IX.Violet: They're formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Cerulean Cave Safari Zone (Peak, default; Mountain, default and 3 Plains points) Trade Dugtrio in Power Plant
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Cerulean Cave Safari Zone (Peak, default; Mountain, default and 3 Plains points) Trade Dugtrio in Power Plant

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Challenge Road , Training Lowlands ( Wanderer ) Fields of Honor , Forest of Focus , Challenge Beach , Brawlers' Cave , Courageous Cavern , Stepping-Stone Sea ( Max Raid Battle ) Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )

Generation IX.Scarlet: North Province: Dalizapa Passage , Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 4★ )
Generation IX.Violet: North Province: Dalizapa Passage , Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 4★ )
Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Canyon Biome , Chargestone Cavern , Polar Biome
